author: Mike Stuart
title: Only worked for a month, valves stuck, very inconsistent
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2019
content: I tried this product out in order to water my lawn. It worked just fine for the first month until I realized that a section of my yard was starting to die. A valve was stuck and wouldn’t open when it was timed to. So I had to start manually watering that area. Then a couple weeks later another valve stopped working and only worked sporadically. Wouldn’t buy again. It was really nice when it did work but I just can’t leave the lawn being watered up to chance. Don’t buy.

author: Biostation Scott
title: Great product
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2019
content: Was used at our streamlab facility to alternate flow between artificial streams very useful for students.

author: Barbara J. Smith
title: Great
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2019
content: Great, bought a second one. Easy to set up. Works like a charm.

author: Rosepetal
title: Easy to install
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2019
content: I read the reviews and decided to purchase this one.  It was easy for my husband to install.  I had no problems programming it for each of the 4 stations.  I manually tested each station and each worked perfectly for the amount of time selected and then shut off.  The instructions are clear and there is a phone number to call if there are any problems.  Now I need to wait to see how the automatic system works.  Will update if there are any issues.

title: Presure
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020
content: Work well for a time, then it would try to operate two or more sprinkler and water pressure not stronger to work

author: jkmayne
title: Best bang for your buck
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020
content:
I purchased this timer for basic lawn watering but have since added several other irrigation zones.
The interface is easy to use even though at first glance it looks overwhelming. I have had no issues with leaks or other parts breaking. Over the year that I have had this product I have only had one issue, after changing my setup the water pressure coming into the unit became too high and prevented the valves from opening. I reached out to the Melnor customer support and got a response the next day. The max PSI is 80 with a min of 20. Installing a pressure regulation valve was an easy cheap fix. I highly recommend this as a budget friendly timer with multiple zone control.

author: Ab
title: very good system
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2019
content: First unit was working well then ran into problems.( about 10 weeks) But I got in touch with melnor customer service rep who sent out a new timer. Do really appreciate the great response.

author: Randall
title: Leaky Piece of Junk
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2019
content:
It leaks. It leaks by where the connection to the main wall hydrant is and it leaks out one of the four valves that is stuck open. Since the premise is you can set the water timer and sprinkler up and leave it to run without you there—you are talking about this thing leaking for hours.

It’s a piece of junk.

author: Sue  Ackley
title: You don’t need to be a wizard to set this up.
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2019
content: What makes me happy about this four-zone timer is how easy it is to hop into a manual schedule add ten minutes to a single zone and walk away. I’m trying to grow grass seed and need to keep areas wet. So, I am always going to the manual addition of minutes when it gets especially hot ourside.

author: Chris H
title: Valves fail quickly
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2019
content: Product doesn't work, after a week it stopped working, internal valves fail immediately.  Amazon replaced the 1st one, and the same thing happend to the second one.

author: Donna Anderson
title: Will save you a lot of time.
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2019
content: Little tricky to learn but once you get it down, they’re awesome. I have 4 of them now and it has reduced the time it takes me to do all the wAtering by 95%. I love them.

author: Melanie Beth Gendell
title: Timer not Working
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2020
content: The Water Timer does not work.  Can you send us another that will work?

author: robn
title: Valves stuck closed
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2019
content: I was given one as a gift and it worked fine for a year so I purchased one. A month later both of them had issues.  The timer says it is watering but the valve does not open.  I emailed the company asking for help.  They sent me a new one.  I was thrilled....same issue. Worked fine for a week. Then in the middle of summer, I noticed that my plants were not happy. Some of the valves were stuck closed again.  I give up.  I am now in search of a better option and watering by hand.

author: Jonathan Black
title: It works
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2020
content: Citrus trees

author: Avid Buyer
title: Does a good job
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2019
content: Programming is tedious

author: Laird A. Pisto
title: Easy setup.
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2019
content: works as advertised.

author: Michelle Oden
title: I like it!
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2019
content: Works perfect! Easy to set. Exactly what I wanted and needed.

author: Derek F.
title: Works as it should
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2019
content: This is great! I have it hooked up with 3 zones and it does everything it should. I've had it about a month.

author: N. Folsom
title: Confusing, tedious user interface
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2019
content: I have had two other Melnor timers, and liked them, so I hoped to like this one. The interface is poor. If you make a mistake setting any zone and press Ok for too long (which isn't long) all settings are lost. I spent 1/2 an hour on trying to get all four set. Life's too short.

author: Jose Franco Guerrero
title: Buen aparato
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2020
content: Bueno hice la programación según las indicaciones y empezó a funcionar como lo programe. Lo mejor que las instituciones también estaban en español. Gracias

author: Keith Kern
title: Easy to use and setup.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2019
content: Very easy to use and setup. Works just like it should. Had to set up 2 zones so the water pressure would remain the same while watering each one. It works perfect!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Cheaply made
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2019
content: I don't like that it appears to be cheaply made.

author: D. Baker
title: Defective -- batteries drain
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2019
content: This model seems to be defective. I have  had 2 so far and both drain the batteries in a matter of days. Disappointing considering the price.

author: Mac
title: Very Important you don't waste your money.
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2019
content: Tried to program following paperwork with unit.  Got to zone 4, kept reverting back to zone one. Numerous attempts, no luck.  Hooked up and audio program.  Came on for zone one, cut off as programmed.  Zone 2 or 3 did not come on.  Unhook from faucet, reprogrammed, only zone 1 worked as specified.  DON'T BUY THIS ITEM , BETTER OF USING SWIMMING POOL TIMER FOR ONE ZONE.

author: Nancy Wilson
title: Don’t trust this timer!
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2019
content: The timer is not reliable. Its program says it’s watering, but the valves often don’t open. On the same day, zone 2 might open, but zone 3 might not. It won’t work 2 days in a row. Maybe it’s the circuit board? Tech support at Melnor replaced it twice. The new timers acted exactly the same, including the supposedly upgraded one in the new package called XT.

author: Chris Foti
title: Don't buy
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2019
content: Didn't work. One of the zones wouldn't shut off. I returned it.

author: BillO
title: Good item
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2019
content: Works great

author: Jennifer A. Smith
title: Worked just how I wanted it to.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2019
content: The timer has been great for my huge backyard and new sod. It was a little cumbersome to program, but pretty straightforward after learning how to cycle through the buttons. I can't figure out how to turn one zone off after programming it other than turning it to 0 minutes, but I might just have to read the manual again to figure it out. It worked really well to keep the new sod nice and wet and covered the yard nicely.

author: Dan C. Farrand
title: Excellent value
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2019
content: Help the grass grow

author: Steve M. Gilbert
title: At the time I want
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2019
content:
I like this timer
Easy to use
No failure... in triple digit temps
I can set time and duration
Good price
Only regret... I should bought 4 way

author: Sonja K.
title: Not reliable
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2019
content: Well when the product works it’s great. Unfortunately the heads for the zone seem to jam up regularly. In the instructions it says to cycle on and off a few times to toggle the zone head. This morning it took me about 7 tries on and off to get one zone to start running. Unfortunately I found out about this problem after leaving town for 2 weeks so many of my plants have been without water for what seems like 3-4 days.

author: Happy
title: Do NOT purchase! Not 'Happy'
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2019
content: This product was horrible.  It NEVER worked. It arrived in just an envelope... NOT even in a package.  To me, this product did NOT appear to be NEW or it would have been in a package.

author: TERRYGSTANLEY
title: Look no further.  This does the job perfectly
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2019
content: Highly adjustable and independent 4 stations.  Fast Amazon delivery.  Good product, highly recommend

author: rick
title: this fit my needs perfectly and reduces existing excess fittings.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2019
content: this eliminates the excess fittings and allowed me to water each area at its own time.

author: Cassie Kinghorn
title: works great
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2019
content: easy to operate, works just as explained

author: FMSGHOST
title: Nice
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
content: Nice product

author: Matthew Bower
title: Good quality for the price.
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2019
content: Can’t tell a difference from more expensive alternatives I’ve owned.

author: Zenda Cloninger
title: Inexpensive solution to zone watering
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2020
content: It was easy to set up and I have used it through one year with no issues.  I have run drip lines through various borders and kept my plants healthy through a lengthy dry spell.  I put it in storage for the winter to keep it from being damaged by the freezing temperatures.

author: Jeffry K
title: Does not work like it should.
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2019
content: I would have given this product 4-5 stars if the total unit worked properly, purchased the unit to water our garden while we were away on vacation.  Took longer than expected to receive so had little time to mess around with, tried to utilize all FOUR (4) Zones but #4 was always on and after re-programming clearing all settings #4 Zone would not work at all.  I had to re-plumb Zone #1 and Zone #4 together which worked OK at best because of dropping water pressure neither Zone watered properly.  Now that we are back from Vacation I can use it Manually but Pretty Pricey Unit to use Manually.

author: Chris Miller
title: Works as well as an expensive irrigation system
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2019
content: Bought two of these to run 8 sprinklers to cover our new yard.  Setup was easy, have worked perfectly twice a day, every day for the past 6 weeks.  Just went out tonight and changed them from turning on everyday to turning on every other day.  Took about 3 minutes to change both of them.

author: Jimmy Longoria
title: Works great!
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2019
content: Great product and service...haven't had any issues

author: Peter J. Johnson
title: Valves Inconsistent
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2020
content: Only one of four valves will open. Waste of time and energy.

author: Betty Vander Vos
title: Works great and easy to install
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2019
content: Read the reviews before you buy.  Bought as a replacement we owned for 10+ yrs. Different brand, but it is working awesome! Love that I can set manual usage on any of the 4 zones whenever I want to. The part about setting the timer for 1 to 7 days is a bit confusing when you've already programed the specific days you want to run the system. Decided to chose 1 day, meaning we want to run the settings of the particular day on one day. Today it works just fine. Not sure if you even need to program the 1 to 7 day second or if it is an alternative to the specific days of the week you want the sprinkler zones to run. Set at one day is working perfectly for us with our pre-defined every other days of the week. Easy to read dials and easy to read indicators on the dials. Has a 7 yr wty and I hope we get many more than that out of it.

author: Tiger
title: Pleased with the features
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2020
content: I really like the features of this timer. I replaced a different brand, but really like this one better because of the manual settings. I don’t have to reprogram it to run a station manually.  I haven’t had it long enough to determine how long it can last. I usually got about 2 years from my former brand.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Broke and started leaking before a year
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2020
content: Worked well for a few months, but the plastic main hose connector broke off before a year.

author: Daniel
title: stays on after cycle
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2020
content: At times, my timer randomly does not shut off after a watering cycle. I have to take the battery out then wait about 20 seconds and then put the batteries back in for it to shut off. That kind of scares me, I don't want it to stay on while I'm away so...I would not buy this item. I previously had the Orbit 3 valve timer for 5 years and never had one issue, I just thought having this 4th valve would be a bit nicer but aparently not!

author: Larry
title: Verify that you received the right product
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2019
content:
I specifically waited for the newer model, this one, because the older version had problems; and ordered this for $10 more. They sent the old product, and that one was defective. It came loose in a bag and the only way you can tell is printed number on the back and instruction. It would not turn on. All the tricks they suggested to fix the known problem did not work.  Be sure they did not send you a 73280. I called tech support, they were not available. Too busy with all the problems.
Once I figured out the error, amazon said they would send the correct one. We shall see. I built the irrigation system before it arrived based on this unit, and have too much invested in the irrigation system to just send this back and avoid the hassle. Which you should consider given all the one stars.

author: Sandra Wade
title: Great product, easy to set up.
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2019
content: Very easy to Set up.  Easy easy easy.  I have two separate Drip systems and I love the manual for watering different things.  I have bought other brands of timers and they just lasted a year. These timers are built so much better.

author: Shed
title: Works as advertised but thricky
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2019
content: So far it seems to water very well, but the procedures for setting cycles and zones are confusing for me.

author: David Anderson
title: Works great. Just needs an extra step
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2019
content:
Having read other reviews, I just went ahead and set each station to run for one minute.  (You can shorten the time to zero after the water starts flowing) This will clear any 'memory state' from the factory.
Its easy to program, and adjust programs.
I haven't played with the extra cycles yet.

author: Marlene Johnson
title: One time setting per zone.
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2019
content: There is only one time setting per zone.

author: Amazon Customer
title: very easy to program.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2020
content: This timer is easy to program compared to the one I replaced.

author: BeachBum62
title: Sprinkler easy peasy
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2019
content: Really worked the way I needed for it to to water my new sod. my only complaint was it was somewhat confusing to switch from programmed time to a non programmed use and back to the programmed time!

author: jamgirl60
title: This works well when it works after 40 days it does not work
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2019
content: This unit has stopped working after 1 month.  Will try to contact the manufacturer to see if we can get some help.

author: Kevin
title: Easy and effective
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2019
content: Amazing timer. Works to the exact time and easy to program

author: Amazon Customer
title: Unreliable, glitchy, broke after 2 months.
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2019
content: Stopped working after 2 months. Return window only one month. Initial setup is a little glitchy.  Not a great option.  Unreliability makes it a liability.  Garden dried up.

author: Gilbert Malnati
title: Melnor Water Timer
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2019
content: Works great, easy to program.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Low water pressure
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2020
content:
I ended up returning this. There is a noticeable drop in pressure when using this timer and not. Enough that my sprinkle misses half the area it did before. This is after removing the wire mesh screen. I was using another brand before it stopped working that didn't have this issue.

As others stated it is also harder to program vs other models I tried. Not impossible. Just took extra effort.

author: Julie
title: Easy to use, very straightforward
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2019
content: This timer is super easy to set up. It has the ability to have all 4 valves start, stop, duration, frequency of watering independent from each other. It also has a manual mode so if you wanted to water right now, you don't have to change any programmed settings. I would reccomend having a pressure control valve on each port to adjust the pressure going to each hose.

author: Raaj
title: Slightly pricey but good overall product
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019
content: Works well, exactly as expected. A tad pricey and I do wish that the screen was back lit, but nevertheless a good product.

author: Joe Chesnas
title: Awesome
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2019
content: Really cool to be able to program 4 zones

author: George Baldwin
title: Power kept shutting off after 2 weeks
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2019
content:
Easy to use and read.

The product however is not high quality. It stopped working after 2 weeks.

author: C
title: Unreliable - Changing to 1 star
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2020
content:
FIRST - I just found out the unit Amazon sent IS NOT the model I ordered. I ordered 65038-AMZ and was sent 73280-19G. They look identical, but apparently the one I was sent just sucks.

Even in testing my sprinkler set up, I've found this thing to be terribly unreliable. Hit manual, chose my zone, set a time... I could hear a click and the little facuet icon would show, but no water would flow. Other times it would work just fine. Once it sprayed water out of an outlet I wasn't even using before switching to the one I had selected a few seconds later.

A few days later - I can't get anything to turn on. I've taken out the batteries. Tried to reset things. NO WATER WILL FLOW. And yes, I checked to make sure the hose bib was on. :)

Melnor is behind on email responses and you can't get help for warranty issues over the phone. The woman I spoke with on the phone was quite nice, though.

author: Charles K. Mobley
title: A little difficult to setup, but well worth the struggle.
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2019
content: It takes a little time to understand how to setup the watering schedule, but once you do, it works really well. I read about the problems with the valves and how to fix the problem in reviews before I started. I made sure to go through the fix with my timer before using it for the first time. I have not had a problem.

author: Chandler
title: Stuck valve issue
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2019
content: I have the newer model  Melnor 65038-AMZ . There was one  valve when stuck open I first installed it. The directions indicated this might happen and the issue was corrected by resetting the valve manually as described in the instructions. So far with one month of daily use there have been no problems.

author: Niki
title: Overall, I would buy it again
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2020
content: Only reason this isn't 5 stars across the board is because it's not very intuitive. Granted, it can be figured out without reading the manual but it is indeed challenging. That being said, it IS  a 4 station timer and is very affordable. 4-1/2 stars

author: Amazon Customer
title: Very dependable
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2019
content: Best one on the market worth every penny

author: JB
title: Not reliable, Avoid
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2019
content:
I bought this item solely because I needed a hose timer with 3 valves.  The fourth was a bonus and the price was fine.  The problem is that the unit does not reliably open the valves.  It gets to the time of execution, I can hear a click but not the loud click of the valve opening.  The time counts down but no water is flowing.  The biggest issue is that you don't realize the valves are not opening until whatever you were watering dies.  It is also very consistent, once a valve stops opening that same valve will never open again using the timer.  I returned the first unit because channel 3 would not open but on the replacement unit channels 2 and 3 do not open.

Most confusing of all is that when I set it to manually open they work fine but when the timer tries to execute the valves do not open.  It is very unreliable.  I ended up going back to my 2 year old Rain Bird which only has 2 channels.

Finally, the newer model is not new.  65038 is just the previous model with 5 useless washers included.  In fact the unit has the old model number on the back but the package shows the new number.

author: Gabriel Teixeira
title: Works great
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2019
content: Works well

author: Dan Abrams
title: Update on June 8, 2019 to Sensor didn't work
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2019
content: After hours of research, I discovered today that the moisture sensor (15339) does indeed work, and that the 4-zone Melnor timer (73280) that I purchased separately also works.  However, the timer seems to be programmed to skip a watering cycle based upon a wet sensor for ONLY Zone 1.  Water continues to flow for the other three zones despite how wet the sensor gets.  This fact is not addressed in any of the Melnor advertising or instruction manuals for either the timer or the sensor.  Customer support at Melnor also was not aware of this.  Perhaps there might be a way to program the timer to respond to signals from the sensor to control flow to Zones, 2, 3 and 4, but that remains a mystery.

author: Ramona Smith
title: Works great.
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2019
content: Easy to set up and use. Does the job. Love that it has 4 channels for the price

author: Linda B.
title: Ability to time 4 different hoses for 4 different days and times!
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2019
content: This item is great!  You can hook up 4 different hoses to it and time each hose for different times to water!

author: Jonna
title: Easy to setup
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2019
content: Great product, easy to use.

author: Janet Hirshberg
title: My plants get watered on schedule!
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2019
content: Getting at the zones to change the program can be confusing but all in all it does the job. You need to be careful to use heavy duty hoses otherwise the hose will compress.

author: Naomi Dyer
title: Buy it. You won’t regret it
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2019
content: I know I’m  a grownup when my favorite purchase is a water timer. I have an older version for my backyard and the newer one(this one) for my front and they just keep getting better. The old one is difficult because the hoses are too close together but this one they have separated the hoses and it’s way easier, also the timer is built in which makes it easier to attach to a faucet. I recommend getting this if your sick of moving hoses all the live long day.

author: William
title: Last for a few months
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2019
content: Had this for about six months and the product stopped worked. I'm thinking possible water intrusion because it keeps trying to come on but it won't.

author: Jeffrey A Joines
title: Doesn't work.
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2020
content: Worked for one day. After that, zones were hit or miss to come on. It sounds like it wants to open, but the valves just stay closed. This is a piece of junk, don't buy it.

author: Jeffrey V. Bialik
title: Does Not Work
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2019
content: This was the second time I have purchased a Melnor product, and the second time the product has simply stopped working after a couple months. The result this time was dead plants while I was out of the country. Evidently the valves stick and don’t open, even on the manual setting.

author: Betty Herrin
title: very easy to set up and works perfect
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2019
content: I like the 4 zones and the ease of programming  and the ability to change to manual if needed.  It works exactely as it is advertised.  I have been using another brand and they did not work as well. I hope it continues to work well I will write another review at the end of the season.

author: Nadim Aziz
title: Great value
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2020
content: Same functionality as one sold by major hardware stores at a significantly better price point. Good quality, easy to setup. Will see how it holds up over time.

author: John Hughes
title: If it works, it's great. If not ...
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2019
content: The first one of these I purchased had a valve stuck in the open position. No matter how many times I tried manually starting and stopping, nothing closed that valve. The replacement unit worked out of the box. When I first added the batteries to the second unit, I could hear each valve close.  If you have worked with sprinkler scheduling computers before you'll find this scheduling system easy enough to figure out. Otherwise, the manual is easy to figure out.

author: Mark R.
title: Works Great
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2019
content: I haven't had any issues. Easy to program and works like a charm.

author: Michael Whisler
title: Works as described
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2019
content: Works pretty good I just wish there was a button to pick a zone and turn on without setting amount of time. Also would be nice to open multiple zones at the same time.

author: Gregg
title: Absolutely Love It!
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2019
content: I was hesitant too purchase based on some of the negative reviews, but I'm glad I bought it. Easy to use once you understand it, all four zones work beautifully, there is no "hammer" noise on water shut off. Just another great Melnor product, it works so good that I bought the two zone for the other side of my house.
